skillTree.localised_description:
“The Men of the Empire reject our Grandfather’s pestilent gifts. Fools! Their false God will not save them from ruin, no matter how desperately they cling onto hope.” 
	– Be’la’krothrogor, the Vile Prince

skillTree.localised_description: The bloated, rotting, maggot-infested bodies of the Exalted Daemons of Nurgle produce a truly foul stench that offends the senses of most beings, but the servants of Nurgle find the acrid miasma invigorating.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: The Children of Doom have one central leader, a Cult Magus, who lords over the Cult Acolytes.

skillTree.localised_description: The Vile Prince was amongst the first batch of priests of the Children of Doom, which formed shortly after the Black Plague of 1111 IC in Marienburg.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +15% for alliances and vassalage with Nurgle
Allegiance points gained: +25% for alliances and vassalage with Nurgle
Allegiance points gained: +35% for alliances and vassalage with Nurgle

skillTree.localised_description: The Vile Prince commands 21 Cult Acolytes, who are placed in most major Imperial cities and several large towns. Each cell has seven to fourteen Cultists, of which about half are aware of the Cult’s greater purpose and ultimate allegiance. Most cells operate in the sewers or in rubbish heaps, though a few are believed to be based in the slums.

effects.description: Grants Line of Sight over major Imperial cities

skillTree.localised_description: Over the centuries, the Vile Prince and his cultists have spread numerous plagues around the Empire and drawn hundreds of people, ranging from workers and servants to soldiers and priests, to bask in the beauty of plague and sickness.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +15%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description:
During the deadly Black Plague of 1111 IC, thousands upon thousands of horrifying Ratmen emerged from the sewers of Marienburg and began a brutal slaughter.  A group of Priests, fleeing the vile Ratmen and the winds of pestilence, barricaded the doors to the Temple of Sigmar, shutting out the evil to protect themselves. The mobs of frightened citizens would have no such protection, and while the Ratmen approached, the commoners pounded on the doors to gain entrance. The frightened Priests withdrew to the catacombs, taking their food and supplies to wait out the violence. Once there, they heard the doors to the Temple splinter and break. They prayed to their God for deliverance, but Sigmar was deaf to their pleading, disdaining them for their cowardice. Despairing, one of their numbers called out to Nurgle for help. The clattering sounds above turned to screams as the Skaven invaders caught up with the desperate citizens. The sounds of battle and carnage carried to the frightened Priests: then, as soon as it began, silence descended and the Skaven went on their way.
	
	 Feeling betrayed by Sigmar, they looked on Nurgle and the Priest who called to him with new respect. It was clear to them Sigmar was no more; they had lived a lie. The only powers, the only Gods, were those of Chaos. One by one, the Priests consecrated themselves to Father Nurgle, becoming his creatures. Thus were the Children of Doom born.

effects.description: Weapon Strength: +15% when fighting against The Empire
Spreads Nurgle corruption in major Imperial cities

skillTree.localised_description: The Vile Prince is one of the more ancient servants of Nurgle, having been fully transformed into an immortal daemon sometime past the year of 1115 IC.

“Can’t you smell it? The stench of death? It’s everywhere. Sigmar is dead, and the stench is the rot of his bloated corpse. It spreads through the lands, polluting our rivers, killing our children, and feeding the armies of death that threaten from the north. Only one can spare us from the suffering, one who wants nothing more than to offer you succour from the death spread by Sigmar’s rot. Embrace Old Father Nurgle. Suckle from his teat, and drink deep the calming nectar of his glorious milk...” 
	 -- Old Fenk, Madman 
	
	The Children of Doom are a secret society of cultists who believe Sigmar is dead, murdered by the other Gods. As his divine body decays, it sickens the world and its people. The cult proclaims the only salvation left remains in Nurgle, casting him as a figure that alleviates suffering rather than being the cause of it. By embracing Nurgle, these cultists believe they will be spared the worst of Sigmar’s disease, and will survive to a new era of comfort and joy.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +25% for alliances with the Empire

No upkeep for the Children of Doom
	(Lord's army)

No upkeep for all Nurgle Agents
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

items.colour_text: A Warrior Priest’s hammer twisted and corrupted with Nurgle’s rot, a foul mockery of the Emperor’s mighty weapon, Ghal Maraz. Be’la’krothrogor uses this weapon to inspire and unite the cultists of Nurgle in a vile echo of Sigmar’s unification of the tribes of Men ages ago.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description: New ability: Twisted Hammer of Sigmar

item_set.name: Grand Magus of the Children of Doom

items.colour_text: A mask of pure Chaotic energy that strikes fear into the hearts of men and inspires nearby cultists. Whilst wearing this mask, the eyes of the wearer shine a burning red; those that stare into his fiery eyes will be struck with abject terror, momentarily paralysing them. All 21 of the original cult members, including Be’la’krothrogor, wore these masks, immortalising it as an icon of the Children of Doom alongside the upside-down hammer. In more recent times, the higher-class members of the Children of Doom wear replicas fashioned in the style of their leader’s iconic mask, though they lack its magical properties.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +4 for mortal followers of Nurgle
	(Lord's army)

Campaign line of sight: +15%
	(all armies in this region and adjacent regions)

item_set.name: Grand Magus of the Children of Doom

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Be’la’krothrogor, or the Vile Prince, as his servants dub him, is an ancient cultist of Nurgle who leads one of the largest and most influential Chaos cults within the Empire, the Children of Doom.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

target_if: Not on or below a platform
